notesStmt.note: Anonymous subscriptions by the scribe, folios 153v, 186v.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: Parts of the Hagiographa, provided with simple superlinear punctuation and a translation and commentary in Arabic.

collation.p:
29 quires originally of 10 leaves each, quire no. 1 and 29 are incomplete.
The quires are signed with Hebrew letters on the upper margin of the first and the lower margin of the last page of a quire.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Yemenite square script, punctuated, of 14th to 15th century.

binding.p: BM in-house. Spine: 'Rabbi Sadia on the Psalms, Etc. Hebrew. Brit. Mus. Oriental 1302.'
